content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Monica and Chandler are making out on one of the chairs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! None of that, not while you’re living under my roof!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, just because I know about you two, doesn’t mean I like looking at it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aren’t you supposed to be at an audition for another hour?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m sorry if I’m not a middle-aged black woman! (Starts for his room.) And I’m also sorry if sometimes I go to the wrong audition! Okay, look, if I have to pretend I don’t know about you two, then you two are gonna have to pretend there’s nothing to know about.

content.speaker: Chandler and Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry.
(They wait for Joey to go into his room and close the door and then start making out again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can hear that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel’s at work.
(They both go to her apartment.)
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can still hear you!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, and Monica are there as Phoebe enters carrying a large box.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, what’s that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, my mom sent me a family heirloom that once belonged to my grandmother. Can you believe it?! A year ago I didn’t even have a family, and now I have heirlooms for crying out loud.
(She puts her leg up on the chair and removes this huge knife from her boot to open the box with. The guys are shocked at the knife’s existence.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eeeee-(She opens the box and removes its contents and sees that it’s a fur coat.)-ohh!! God! (She throws it at Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Argh-argh!! (Catches the coat.) Ooh, soft. Is this mink?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Why would my mother send me a fur? Doesn’t she know me but at all! Plus, I have a perfectly fine coat that no innocent animal suffered to make!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, just some 9-year-old Filipino kids who worked their fingers bloody for 12 cents an hour. (Phoebe stares at him wide-eyed. Chandler sees her reaction.) That didn’t happen, I made that up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh, Ross? Ross! You can’t put up flyers in here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How come? Everybody else does.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: You can’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, umm, I’m just getting rid of a couple of things.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is all of your things.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes it is! No, but it’s good it’s—Emily thinks we should get all new stuff. Stuff that’s just ours, together. Y’know brand new.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So basically, this is a getting-rid-of-everything-Rachel-ever-used sale.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Touched. Used. Sat on. Sleep on.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I’ll take it all.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Ross, you’re okay with that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, if I can just do what Emily wants and get her to New York, I’m sure everything will be fine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but don’t you think this is a little extreme?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: After what I did? Can you blame her?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! You got off easy! When my friend Silvie’s husband said someone else’s name in bed, she cursed him and turned his thingy green.
(Ross suddenly gets up and heads for the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is he doing? What, Emily, thinks Ross’s furniture has got Rachel coodies?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now calm down Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! Everything’s gettin’ all messed up, y’know? Emily won’t let Ross see Rachel, we’re not gonna stop seeing Rachel, hence Ross stops seeing us!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I hate this. Everything’s changing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah I know, we’re losing Ross, Joey said hence…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I’m not happy about this either, but y’know if-if Ross says he’s happy then we’re just gonna have to keep our feelings about Emily to ourselves. Are you cool with that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! But y’know, I’m an actor, I’ll act cool.

content.description: The Storage Room in the basement of Monica and Rachel’s building, Monica and Rachel are looking for something.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, whoa God! Storage rooms give me the creeps! Monica, come on please hurry up honey! Please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, if you want the little round waffles, you gotta have to wait until I find the little waffle iron.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I want the little round waffles.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. (Looking through a box.) Op, here it is! Right underneath the can of-of bug bomb. I wonder if the best place to put something that cooks food is underneath the can of poison?
(The single light flickers and goes out. Leaving the room in total darkness.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what? I’ll-I’ll have toast!
(She starts to run out but is stopped by a figure looming out of the darkness carrying a pick axe.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Arghhhh!!!!!!
(They both start screaming at the top of their lungs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Fog him! Fog him!
(Rachel grabs the bug bomb, activates it, throws it at the figure, and they both run out through the fog.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know what I’m gonna do about this coat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll take it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That might work! (She gives him the coat.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh-ooh-ooh, yeah! (He drapes it around his shoulders.) Enh? All right, what do you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re on in 5 Ms. Minnelli.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no, it’s just a bit sudden. (Listens) No, it’s great. Okay? I’m totally on board. I love you too, all righty. Bye. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the matter Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing. Oh, actually, great news! I just got off the phone with Emily and it looks like I’m moving to a new apartment. Woo-hoo!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, her thought is, and I agree, fresh new furniture, why not a fresh new apartment? Her cousin has this great place to sublet, it’s got a view of the river on one side and Columbia on the other.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s way uptown! That’s like three trains away! (Phoebe pinches him.) Which is great! I love to ride that rail!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you’re really okay with this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! Yes! I mean it’s-it’s kinda far from work, but uh, y’know, I’ll get so much done on the commute. I-I’ve been given the gift of time!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now that’s so funny, because last Christmas I got the gift of space. We should get them together and make a continuum.
(Ross exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now he’s movin’? Man, what is Emily doing to him? (Phoebe pinches him again.) Ow!! He’s not even here!!!
(Monica and Rachel enter breathless.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys! You guys!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We were, we were just in the storage area and we saw this really creepy man!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It was like this crazy-eyed, hairy beast man! He was like a, like a bigfoot or a yeti or something!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And he came at us with an axe, so Rachel had to use a bug bomb on him!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I-I-I just pulled the tab and I just fogged his yeti ass!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, like dark hair, bushy beard?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you fogged Danny.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please! We did not fog Danny! Who’s Danny?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dan just moved in downstairs. Yeah, he just got back from like this four-month trek in the Andes. Nice fella.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh he’s nice. He’s nice! Y’know, you always stick up for the people we fog!

content.description: Their Building, Monica and Rachel are going to apologize to Danny. Rachel knocks on his door, which he opens and he has this really bushy beard and long hair. Picture Paul Bunyan.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! You might not remember us, but we are the girls that fogged you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re-we’re really sorry we fogged you.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Okay.
(He closes the door. Rachel’s not happy with that and knocks again. He opens the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Just so you know, we-we didn’t mean to fog you, we thought you were like a yeti or something.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Okay.
(He closes the door again. Once again, Rachel knocks (harder this time) and he answers it.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Yesss?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Sorry to bother you, but I don’t think we can accept your acceptance of our apology, it just doesn’t really seem like you mean it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: O-kay !
(He closes the door before Rachel can say anything.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! That guy is so rude!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really! What is with that guy? I mean you’d forgive me if I fogged you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well you did a little bit.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, honey, I’m so sorry!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I totally forgive you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is making a drink as Phoebe enters with the fur coat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So listen, you know my friend Chris who owns the crematorium?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Crematorium Chris? Sure!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He says, that he would cremate my fur coat for free if I umm, y’know, bring in the next person I know who dies.
(Rachel enters from the bathroom and sees the coat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God, look at these pelts!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t get too attached, she’s having it cremated.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Uhh, Phoebe, honey, honey, I know you’re quirky and I get a big kick out of it, we all do actually, but if you destroy a coat like this that is like a crime against nature! Not nature, fashion !

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is fashion?! (Grabs the coat from Rachel.) Okay, so to you, death is fashion?! That’s really funny. (She puts the coat on and starts to model it.) Here’s Phoebe umm, sporting uh, y’know, cutting edge hairy carcass from y’know, the steal traps of wintry Russia. I mean, you really thing this looks good? (Sees herself in the mirror.) ’Cause I do.

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, the gang is helping Ross move out by carrying boxes. Chandler has picked a particularly large and apparently heavy box, because he takes a running start at it and still can’t budge it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know I miss you too. I can’t wait to see you. I love you. Bye. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, what is in here? Rocks?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, this is my collection of fossil samples.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, rocks.
(He picks up a smaller box and carries it to the moving van as Joey returns.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m really gonna miss this apartment. Y’know, Ben-Ben took his first steps right over there. (Points.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh. Hey, remember when I ran into this thing (The shutters that close off the kitchen.) and it kinda knocked me out a little?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I loved this place! To tell you the truth, I wish I didn’t have to move.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, are you saying that you’re not entirely happy about this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I mean if uh, if Emily gave me a choice…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You do have a choice!! Ross, why are you listening to her?! Are you, are you crazy?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not right what Emily wants you to do! She is totally-(The gang enters behind Joey and Phoebe pinches him again.)-Owww!! Stop pinching me! Look, now you guys said I only had to keep my mouth shut as long as Ross was happy, right? Well he just told me that he’s not entirely happy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We all hate Emily!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nooo!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, Ross, we do not hate Emily. We-we just, we just think that you’re having to sacrifice a whole lot to make her happy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, we just think that maybe she’s being a little unreasonable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Yes! Unreasonable!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Unreasonable? How about we have this conversation when one of you guys gets married! You have no idea what it takes to make a marriage work! All right, it’s about compromise! Do you always like it? No! Do you do it? Yes! Because it’s not all laughing, happy, candy in the sky, drinking coffee at Central Perk all the time! It’s real life, okay? It’s what grown-ups do! (He storms out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think he’s right. You guys hang out at the coffeehouse way too much.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Phoebe, Joey, and Chandler are recovering from Ross’s rebuke.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God, I feel so guilty about Ross.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I kinda feel like it’s my fault.
(Monica and Chandler turn and stare at him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kind of? If you just kept this to yourself none of this would’ve happened.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m keeping so many things to myself these days, something was bound to slip out! (He glares at Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I think it’s very brave what you said.
(Monica pats Joey on the shoulder.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I can’t sit here anymore. I have to walk places. (She puts on her fur coat.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs, what are you doing with the coat? How about the whole animal rights thing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’ve been reading up and for your information, minks are not very nice. Okay, I admit it! I love this coat! Okay, I—it’s the best thing I’ve ever had wrapped around me, including Phil Huntley! (She starts to leave but stops and says to Monica.) Remember Phil Huntley? He was fine!

content.description: Their building’s lobby, Danny is checking his mailbox as Rachel enters carrying shopping bags and goes to her mailbox. Danny has shaved his beard and cut his hair, Rachel doesn’t recognize him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: So you like the short hair better.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Yeti—I mean Danny?

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: I had to cut my hair to get rid of the uh, fogger smell.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Listen, I’m so sorry. I would, I would’ve never fogged you if y’know if you hadn’t looked so… Y’know.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Absolutely. Some people are just into appearances.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: That’s cool. Cool. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Hey! No-no-no! This not cool! You don’t even know me!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Come on, you got the shopping bags and the Sack’s catalog.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So from that you think you’ve got me all figured out? Well, you don’t! Y’know I-I could have toys for underprivileged kids in here!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Do you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know, if-if kids like to play with Capri pants.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Okay. (Heads for his apartment.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And stop saying that! I hate that!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Okay!
(Rachel decides not to give up that easily and follows him to his apartment and bangs on the door, which he opens.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine! I judged you. I made a snap judgement. But you did it too! And you are worse because you are sticking to your stupid snap judgement! You can’t even open up your mind for a second to see if you’re wrong! What does that say about you?

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: The pizza-place across the street any good?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: I’m hungry. Wanna get some pizza? You can keep yelling if there’s more.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Stop saying that. I hate that.

content.description: Ross’s now empty apartment, he is spackling some holes shut as the gang comes to apologize.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, Ross?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you still mad at us?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good! Because we have an “I’m sorry” song.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I’m really not in the mood.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Ross, I feel really bad. I mean, you’re going through all this stuff and I just acted like a jerk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we are so sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re kinda stepping on the song. (She gets ready to play but is stopped by…)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, we were way out of line, we totally support you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whatever you decide, whatever you do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, now you’re just taking lines right out of the song!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, this is hard enough! I really need you guys right now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! Exactly! And that’s why…
(She starts to play her song, but is stopped by Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you come over tonight? And I’ll make you favorite dinner.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Thanks you guys. Pheebs are you wearing fur?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, let’s get some perspective people; it’s not like I’m wearing a seeing-eye dog coat!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang, minus Rachel, are getting ready for dinner.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, y’know Ross, I think I kinda understand why I kinda lost it today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You do, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah you see umm, well, I’m an actor. Right? So I gotta keep my emotions right at the surface y’know? See what I’m saying? I gotta lot of balls in the air. (Makes like he’s juggling.) Y’know what I mean? It’s tough! Guys like me, y’know, you wander around, you’re alone…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not sure.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, look at you! Where have you been?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I went to have pizza. With Danny.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How did that happen?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That yeti is one smooth talker.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hope you’re not full, ’cause dinner’s almost ready.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, y’know I-I think I’m just gonna hang out in my room.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No! Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on you guys! Listen, if Emily knew I was here having dinner with you she would flip out and you know it. It’s okay, I really… I don’t mind.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait! Wait! Wait! Y’know what? Just stay. Please? It uh… It would really mean a lot to me if you stayed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rachel PLEASE!!! JUST HAVE DINNER WITH US!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay. Joey, it’s okay. Settle down.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I-I’m sorry. I’m sorry. You see Rach I’m an actor…
[Time lapse, dinner is now finished and Ross is looking out the window.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Hey, look! Ugly Naked Guy’s back!
(They all run over to the window.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I haven’t seen him in so long!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God, I really missed that fat bastard!
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, this is so weird. I just realized this might be the last time we’ll all be hanging out together.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s almost as if he knew.
(The phone rings.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll get it. (On phone.) Hello. (Listens.) Hi Emily! (Listens.) Yeah, uh you-you tracked him down. Hold on one second. (She hands the phone to Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! (Listens.) Yeah-yeah, we’re just having dinner. (Listens.) Uh, yeah, sure uh hold on. (To the gang.) She wants to say hi. (To Emily) Hold on.
(Ross puts her on speakerphone.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Emily!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Hello everyone. So who am I saying hello too?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well uh, I don’t know about who’s here, but I can tell you for damn sure who’s not here and that’s Rachel!!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Well, I should hope not. Ross knows better than that by now.
(Rachel waves her hands in disgust and starts to head for her room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? Uh, Rachel is here! (Rachel stops.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: She’s there?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, there-there she is!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah, she’s here.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross, take me off speakerphone.
(He does so.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: How can you do this too me?! I thought I’d made my feelings about Rachel perfectly clear!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Emily, I’m just having dinner with my friends, okay?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You obviously can’t keep away from her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily that’s ridiculous. Look, I’m-I’m moving for you, I’m cutting friends out of my life for you. Please, just get on the plane and come to New York. Okay, you’ll see you’re the only person I want to be with.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I’ll feel better when I’m there, and I can know where you are all the time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you can’t know where I am all the time. Look, this marriage is never gonna work if you don’t trust me.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You’re right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, can you trust me?
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: No.
(Ross lowers his head.)
[Cut to the inside of the apartment.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think it’s going okay. Looks like he’s smiling.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How can you tell? You can only see the back of his head!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You can totally tell! Here look, watch me. (He stands up and turns his back to them so that he is facing the window.) Smile! Frown. Smile! Frown. (The camera cuts to Ross outside hanging up the phone.) Smile! (Ross turns around and sees Joey alternately smiling and frowning and just stares at him for a second and heads back inside.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I guess that’s it.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Why, what happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What happened? What happened?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My marriage is over.

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, sweetie. Oh, look at you. You’re shivering.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here. (She wraps her coat around his shoulders.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, honey, is there anything we can do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. You can help me get my furniture back from Gunther.

content.description: A curbside newsstand, Phoebe is whistling and walking up to it wearing her fur coat. She stops and starts to look through a magazine and notices a squirrel on a nearby tree chirping at her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, stop tormenting me! This mink! Okay, they’re mean! And they hate squirrels! And y’know, okay, most of these probably wanted to be coats! (The squirrel stares at her.) All right, fine, now I get it. (To the clerk.) Here. (She hands him her coat.) You take it. (To the squirrel.) Are you happy now? I’m cold!
